metadata.title: CVE-2020-28242 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Asterisk Open Source 13.x before 13.37.1, 16.x before 16.14.1, 17.x before 17.8.1, and 18.x before 18.0.1 and Certified Asterisk before 16.8-cert5. If Asterisk is challenged on an outbound INVITE and the nonce is changed in each response, Asterisk will continually send INVITEs in a loop. This causes Asterisk to consume more and more memory since the transaction will never terminate (even if the call is hung up), ultimately leading to a restart or shutdown of Asterisk. Outbound authentication must be configured on the endpoint for this to occur.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-28242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-config - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mobile - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-modules - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mysql - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-tests - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-vpb - 1:16.15.0~dfsg-1
No subscription required
